main event: A silver, cigar-shaped object was observed in the Azores (Atlantic) in an incident on September 26, 1952.
interesting points: The object was stationary and lighted irregularly.
It was observed by the crew of a C-121 aircraft for approximately 8 minutes.
The object was described as very bright, stationary, triangular in shape, and alternately leading each other.
It was determined that the object could not have been another aircraft or surface vessel in the area.
The incident was attributed to a possible light phenomenon similar to the 'green fireballs' that had been reported in the area, but the exact nature was undetermined.
